    Writing Policy Files

Writing Policy Files

Source: vignettes/policy-files.Rmd
policy-files.Rmd

There are two ingredients that are needed to calculate course grades with gradebook: a data frame containing assignment scores and a file that encodes the grading policies often described in a syllabus. We call that file a policy file.

Policy files are stored as .yaml files, a simple format for storing hierarchical data in a text file with minimal markup. Here is an example of a policy file for a course with a fairly simple grading scheme.

coursewide:
  course: Stat 101

categories:
  - category: Labs
    weight: 0.30
    aggregation: weighted_by_points
    assignments:
      - "Lab 1"
      - "Lab 2"
      - "Lab 3"
      - "Lab 4"
      - "Lab 5"
      - "Lab 6"
  - category: Discussion
    weight: 0.10
    aggregation: equally_weighted
    assignments:
      - "Discussion 1"
      - "Discussion 2"
  - category: Midterm
    weight: 0.30
    aggregation: none
    assignments:
      - "Midterm"
  - category: Final
    weight: 0.30
    aggregation: none
    assignments:
      - "Final"

Once you have written your policy file, you can read it into R as a list.

yaml::read_yaml(system.file("extdata", "simple_policy.yaml", package = "gradebook"))
#> $coursewide
#> $coursewide$course
#> [1] "Stat 101"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories
#> $categories[[1]]
#> $categories[[1]]$category
#> [1] "Labs"
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$aggregation
#> [1] "weighted_by_points"
#> 
#> $categories[[1]]$assignments
#> [1] "Lab 1" "Lab 2" "Lab 3" "Lab 4" "Lab 5" "Lab 6"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]
#> $categories[[2]]$category
#> [1] "Discussion"
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$weight
#> [1] 0.1
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$aggregation
#> [1] "equally_weighted"
#> 
#> $categories[[2]]$assignments
#> [1] "Discussion 1" "Discussion 2"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]
#> $categories[[3]]$category
#> [1] "Midterm"
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$aggregation
#> [1] "none"
#> 
#> $categories[[3]]$assignments
#> [1] "Midterm"
#> 
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]
#> $categories[[4]]$category
#> [1] "Final"
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$weight
#> [1] 0.3
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$aggregation
#> [1] "none"
#> 
#> $categories[[4]]$assignments
#> [1] "Final"
# to be replaced with gradebook::read_policy()
